articles.author: Chetana Belagere
articles.title: India leads in WHO's Southeast Asia stroke chart: Where are we going wrong? - South First
articles.description: Strokes are projected to account for 10 million deaths annually by 2050. Doctors suggest where we are going wrong and how to prevent strokes.
articles.content: Research has long indicated that stroke is one of the leading causes of death globally. In 2019, India saw a staggering 1.3 million new cases of stroke, topping the charts in the World Health Organis… [+10063 chars]
